**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-02T22:27:26Z" title="10/02/2017 10:27  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 2, 2017</time> by Frozen\_Heart**

I have a quick question about habitation that I haven't been able to find an answer to. I built a spacecraft that included a living space section with far more than enough habitation for the crew on board. Everything went great until the end, when I ran into a problem. I had a return capsule with a heat shield and parachutes that jettisoned from the rest of the spacecraft for reentry. The instant I fired that stage, the crew inside the the capsule dropped from 160 days or so to 0 habitation and went on strike. Why does this happen? I understand that decoupling from the rest of the living space means I lose all the habitation benefits from those parts, but shouldn't it just go down to whatever the maximum hab time in the return capsule is?

Thanks for the help!

[@Frozen_Heart](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/118627-frozen_heart/) Your're missing 000\_USITools from GameData. It should have been included in the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS zip.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, Aelfhe1m said:
> 
> 
> [@Frozen_Heart](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/118627-frozen_heart/) Your're missing 000\_USITools from GameData. It should have been included in the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS zip.
> 

Hmm odd. Extracted the whole thing into game data.

Will redownload and see if i somehow ended up deleting the file.

Thanks.

Edit: That worked. I must have somehow deleted that file without ever seeing it was there.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-03T08:27:45Z" title="10/03/2017 08:27  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 3, 2017</time> by Frozen\_Heart**

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, Orbnu said:
> 
> 
> I have a quick question about habitation that I haven't been able to find an answer to. I built a spacecraft that included a living space section with far more than enough habitation for the crew on board. Everything went great until the end, when I ran into a problem. I had a return capsule with a heat shield and parachutes that jettisoned from the rest of the spacecraft for reentry. The instant I fired that stage, the crew inside the the capsule dropped from 160 days or so to 0 habitation and went on strike. Why does this happen? I understand that decoupling from the rest of the living space means I lose all the habitation benefits from those parts, but shouldn't it just go down to whatever the maximum hab time in the return capsule is?
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks for the help!
> 

If you launched it as one piece, and then staged the return capsule what likely happened is that KSP saw it as staging away the habitation:  That is, you're still in the same ship, it's just smaller now.  So you don't reset habitation like you would if you entered a new ship, instead you keep your current time-in-ship.  (I think having docked the return capsule might have helped - but if it'd been docked long enough it might not have.)

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, DStaal said:
> 
> 
> If you launched it as one piece, and then staged the return capsule what likely happened is that KSP saw it as staging away the habitation:  That is, you're still in the same ship, it's just smaller now.  So you don't reset habitation like you would if you entered a new ship, instead you keep your current time-in-ship.  (I think having docked the return capsule might have helped - but if it'd been docked long enough it might not have.)
> 

I see. Is there any way to stop this from happening? With this problem in mind, I'm not sure how to design a ship that travels far and does not stay in one big piece. Out of curiosity, if this is the case, how do other people go about making landers for ships on long-duration missions?

Edit: I think I figured it out! DStaal, you were right, it seems to totally be about the staging. From what I've tested, it seems to be dependent on what the root of the spacecraft is. If the root of the craft had not been on the return capsule when I had staged, it would have counted as another spacecraft when it jettisoned and everything would have worked as expected.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-03T19:01:16Z" title="10/03/2017 07:01  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 3, 2017</time> by Orbnu**

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Tools is causing 1.3.1 to crash after the load screen just prior to the Menu screen coming up.   I'm using <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> and noticed that after trying to install <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support.  So I used <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">Ckan</abbr> to install / uninstall things one at a time and finally narrowed it down to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Tools, which is a dependency for a lot of things.   I have the logs, but wanted to see if this was already a known issue with the latest update for KSP before I go doing a full on bug report.

> 
>

So I used <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">Ckan</abbr> to install / uninstall things one at a time and finally narrowed it down to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Tools, which is a dependency for a lot of things.   I have the logs, but wanted to see if this was already a known issue with the latest update for KSP before I go doing a full on bug report.

hrm... will take a look, they should have been fine with pre-release
What pre-release is that? My USITools.version says it is 0.9.3.0, and I'm seeing the same symptoms (crash just when the loading bar finishes).

I am having the same problem since the new KSP Version 1.3.1? has come out. I was able to narrow it down to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support and or its dependencies. 

log says: mono.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)  

  in module mono.dll at 0033:e4ba0e18.

The life support tab was not coming up for me in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> when I upgraded to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS 0.7.0.0 and MKS 0.53.0.0 with USITools 0.10.1.0 on KSP 1.3.1.1891.  I resolved it by installing CCK 2.0.2.  I recommend updating this and all relevant <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> bundles.  I've submitted an issue on the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS GitHub.
This is why <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Tools includes Mini-AVC, as it is non-trivial to publish the entire constellation.

Quick question... I want to increase the Hab/Home timers to double their current values (so my basic 2-man pod can go for 14 days instead of 7). I've tried editing the BaseHabTime and the HabMultiplier values in both the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/Settings.cfg and MKS/Patches/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.cfg files, yet it doesn't seem to be taking effect in-game. Am I editing the wrong value or will it only apply to a newly launched ship?

Thanks

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Fourjays said:
> 
> 
> Quick question... I want to increase the Hab/Home timers to double their current values (so my basic 2-man pod can go for 14 days instead of 7). I've tried editing the BaseHabTime and the HabMultiplier values in both the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/Settings.cfg and MKS/Patches/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.cfg files, yet it doesn't seem to be taking effect in-game. Am I editing the wrong value or will it only apply to a newly launched ship?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks
> 

those are just the default settings.  They are loaded into your persistent save file once you start a new game.  You would want to edit the current save to change your current game

> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, goldenpsp said:
> 
> 
> those are just the default settings.  They are loaded into your persistent save file once you start a new game.  You would want to edit the current save to change your current game
> 

Cheers, I found the options and it is working now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
